page.title: 15Landscape
page.content: The land around the Glinton area is very flat and full of fields of corn,sugarbeet,barley and wheat.The soil is very good so most of these crops are grown year after year.Years ago at the time of the Ice Age all the area was covered with glaciers which caused the land to be pushed further and further downwards.This is why the roads are higher than the actual fields.Later when the Dutch had discovered how to recover the land from under water they came over to this part of the world to recover the area which was now all marsh and bogs.This was done by digging dykes so that all the water would drain from the land.Since then our soil has always been moist and good for growing crops.
